1: <sup>1</sup> O give thanks unto the LORD; call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.
2: <sup>2</sup> Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.
3: <sup>3</sup> Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.
4: <sup>4</sup> Seek the LORD, and his strength: seek his face evermore.
5: <sup>5</sup> Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;
6: <sup>6</sup> O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob his chosen.
7: <sup>7</sup> He is the LORD our God: his judgments are in all the earth.
8: <sup>8</sup> He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.
9: <sup>9</sup> Which covenant he made with Abraham, and his oath unto Isaac;
10: <sup>10</sup> And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:
11: <sup>11</sup> Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance:
12: <sup>12</sup> When they were but a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.
13: <sup>13</sup> When they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people;
14: <sup>14</sup> He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;
15: <sup>15</sup> Saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.
16: <sup>16</sup> Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he brake the whole staff of bread.
17: <sup>17</sup> He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a servant:
18: <sup>18</sup> Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:
19: <sup>19</sup> Until the time that his word came: the word of the LORD tried him.
20: <sup>20</sup> The king sent and loosed him; even the ruler of the people, and let him go free.
21: <sup>21</sup> He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:
22: <sup>22</sup> To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.
23: <sup>23</sup> Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
24: <sup>24</sup> And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.
25: <sup>25</sup> He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.
26: <sup>26</sup> He sent Moses his servant; and Aaron whom he had chosen.
27: <sup>27</sup> They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.
28: <sup>28</sup> He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.
29: <sup>29</sup> He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.
30: <sup>30</sup> Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.
31: <sup>31</sup> He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies, and lice in all their coasts.
32: <sup>32</sup> He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.
33: <sup>33</sup> He smote their vines also and their fig trees; and brake the trees of their coasts.
34: <sup>34</sup> He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,
35: <sup>35</sup> And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.
36: <sup>36</sup> He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.
37: <sup>37</sup> He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there was not one feeble person among their tribes.
38: <sup>38</sup> Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.
39: <sup>39</sup> He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.
40: <sup>40</sup> The people asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
41: <sup>41</sup> He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places like a river.
42: <sup>42</sup> For he remembered his holy promise, and Abraham his servant.
43: <sup>43</sup> And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness:
44: <sup>44</sup> And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;
45: <sup>45</sup> That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the LORD.
